    ABOUT VIETNAM MOTORBIKE TOUR EXPERT

    SaPa Ha Giang Cao Bang Ha Noi Capital Hue Hoi An Central Highland
    (Tay Nguyen)     Ho Chi Minh City Mekong Delta Ho Chi Minh trail Hoang Sa islands
    (Vietnam)     Truong Sa islands
    (Vietnam)

    Riding off the beaten track through Vietnam, seeing breathtaking landscapes, beautiful mountain passes, interesting historical relics, meeting friendly & interesting people…made us love our country more and gave us a special feeling.

    We wanna take you there to share our love for Vietnam with you! Vietnam Motorbike Tour Expert is a group of local tour operators and guides who have years of experience in organizing and guiding motorcycle tours to any corners of the country, from majestic North Vietnam, stunning Central highlands or on legendary Ho Chi Minh trail.

    Many years of riding motorbike tours in Vietnam with riders from all over the world have taught us how to create a perfect motorcycle trip for you, tailored to your every desire. We offer a wide variety of guided and personalized motorbike tours, each one designed to suit your unique needs and preferences. So just contact us and we together enjoy the adventure motorbike trip of your lifetime in Vietnam!

    LIKE THE WAY WE CARE OUR CUSTOMERS

    1. Honda CRF300L

    • Engine Type: liquid-cooled single-cylinder four-stroke
    • Capicity: 286cc
    • Max Power: 27bhp
    • Front suspension: Non-adjustable inverted 43mm fork; 10.2 in
    • Rear suspension: Linkage-assisted non-adjustable shock; 10.2 in
    • Kerb weight: 142kg
    • Seat height: 880 mm
    Contact now

    2. Honda CRF250L

    • Engine Type: Liquid-cooled four-stroke DOHC single
    • Capicity: 250cc
    • Max Power: 23bhp
    • Front suspension: 43mm diameter upside down forks
    • Rear suspension: Pro-Link single shock, preload adjust
    • Kerb weight: 144kg
    • Seat height: 875mm
    Contact now

    3. Honda XR150L

    • Engine Type: Single cylinder - four-stroke OHV.4 Valve
    • Capicity: 149cc
    • Max Power: 12.5 bhp
    • Front suspension: 33mm telescopic fork
    • Rear suspension: 150mm
    • Kerb weight: 128kg
    • Seat height: 825mm
    Contact now

    FAQs

    Is an International License valid in Vietnam?

    “Can I ride a motorbike legally in Vietnam with my international driving license or with my home country license? ”could be the most popular question and it’s still the hard question to answer because it’s hard to find the official information from local authority or any office website of the government.

    From the latest updates, the regulations for foreign tourists riding motorbikes legally in Vietnam with an international driving license were not consistent throughout the country. The requirements varied by region and were subject to change.

    Generally, Northern Vietnam authorities allow foreign tourists to ride motorbikes with an International Driving Permit (IDP) in addition to their valid home country driver’s license, while other regions require a Vietnamese motorbike license to ride legally in Vietnam.

    However, after over 10 years of riding motorcycle tours in Vietnam, we can tell the good news is police and local authorities are quite friendly with tourists so if you can ride a motorbike well and carefully after the local tour guide, no police will stop or care about your license. Especially with a valid international license, and if you don’t ride over the speed limit…you can ride to any places in Vietnam

    So the answer to the question “Is international license valid in Vietnam” is YES. The ONLY problem is the INSURANCE, many travel insurance companies don’t cover this kind of trip if tourists don’t have Vietnamese motorbike licenses.

    Where to buy insurance for motorcycle trips in Vietnam?

    The biggest insurance companies in Vietnam are Bao Viet( National Insurance Company) and Gras Savoye Willis (French Insurance Broker). They are big in Vietnam but they won’t cover you if you have no Vietnamese motorbike riding license. To get a Vietnamese motorcycle license or convert your license to a Vietnamese one is complicated and takes plenty of time to do paperwork and wait.
    Therefore, the suggestion is that you’d better buy insurance in your home country before coming on tour by motorbike in Vietnam. Below is the recommendation from the riders who do tour with us: QBE Insurance: https://www.qbe.com.au/ or Seven Corners: https://www.sevencorners.com/ or https://www.oldoakinsurance.co.uk/

    Where to buy insurance for motorcycle trips in Vietnam

    The biggest insurance companies in Vietnam are Bao Viet( National Insurance Company) and Gras Savoye Willis (French Insurance Broker). They are big in Vietnam but they won’t cover you if you have no Vietnamese motorbike riding license. To get a Vietnamese motorcycle license or convert your license to a Vietnamese one is complicated and takes plenty of time to do paperwork and wait (from 5- 7 working days). It’s complicated becasue you need to have at least 3 month resident visa and you need to be here to do  payperwork yourself.
    Therefore, the suggestion is that you’d better buy insurance in your home country before coming on tour by motorbike in Vietnam. Below is the recommendation from the riders who do tour with us: QBE Insurance: https://www.qbe.com.au/ or Seven Corners: https://www.sevencorners.com/ or https://www.oldoakinsurance.co.uk/

    Frequently Asked Questions about Vietnam Motorbike Tour Expert

    Can I ride motorbikes legally in Vietnam?

    According to the regulations of the Ministry of Transport, foreigners or Vietnamese residing abroad, if you want to drive in Vietnam, here are the following rules if you have:

    • A national driving license, you must carry out procedures to change to a corresponding Vietnamese driving license.
    • An international driving license issued by the competent authorities of the countries participating in the 1968 Convention on Road Traffic, and the validity period is still valid, you are allowed to drive the type of vehicle specified in the driving license.
    • In case an international treaty on driving licenses to which Vietnam is a contracting party contains different provisions, the provisions of such international treaty shall apply.

    Tourists who had registered in the 1949 convention, will have to transfer to a Vietnamese legal permit. You can follow these steps:

    • Prepare all the documents:
      • Three 3x4cm photos
      • Translated and verified copy of your IDP (verified by your embassy)
      • Verified copy of your passport (verified by your embassy)
      • Original passport
      • Original driving license
      • Original residence card
      • A filled form of the Transit Authority
    • Go to the Department of Transportation in Hanoi or Saigon.
    • Give all the documents to the officer and take another photo for their database. (Officers will make copies and scans of all documents and return the originals)
    • Then, fill out the postal form pay 30,000 VND, and take the receipt in case to present it to the courier.
    • Wait about 10 days to get the license through express delivery.

    Notes: Driving a 50cc motorbike in Vietnam is legal but you should consider getting a diving license to make your motorcycle tour in Vietnam more interesting.

    What should I bring on the tours?

    Summary of things that you should bring on a Vietnam motorcycle tour

    Passport

    A passport is the most important item to bring whenever you travel abroad, make sure your passport is valid for at least six months. If you are not from these countries: Japan, Korea, Russian Federation, Denmark, Indonesia, Norway, Thailand, Finland, Sweden, Singapore, Malaysia, Philippines, and many other Asian countries; you must have a valid visa to enter Vietnam and join motorbike tours of Vietnam.

    Driving license

    This license is necessary when you join the motorcycle tour in Vietnam. To get a driving license that is legal in Vietnam, you could watch ‘Can I ride motorbikes legally in Vietnam?’

    Copies of passport and identification card

    In emergencies and unexpected situations, having these copies in paper and scanned to PDF (save on your phone) will greatly help you.

    Money and Credit Cards

    When you participate in motorbike tours of Vietnam, money is very important to serve the needs of food and other stuff. However, we still recommend you bring Master and Visa cards to avoid the risk of putting too much cash outside. You could exchange the money in banks and gold shops.

    • All accommodation on tour (twin share room in a hotel or stay at a homestay as mentioned in itinerary)
    • Boat rides on lakes or crossing rivers as mentioned in the itinerary
    • All entrance fees / Permits
    • Hotel pick up/drop off before and after the tour
    • Quality video of the trip
    • Souvenirs from our team (Café Cup, Cap…)
    • Tour price excludes:
    • Medical insurance
    • Bike damages
    • Personal expense
    • Drinks/Tips

    BOOKING CONDITIONS:

    Reservation Process:

    Your booking is confirmed upon receipt of the deposit. To secure your reservation, we request a small deposit, typically ranging from 10% to 30% of the total tour cost

    Payment Policies:

    When you’re ready to book a tour, we will send you a secure payment link, allowing you to pay the required deposit using your credit cards (3,5% will be surcharged for the bank service fee)

    The balance will be paid in full at our shop just before starting the tour. You can pay in cash (USD or Euro) or by credit card (3,5% will be surcharged for the bank fee if you pay by credit card)

    Cancellation and Refund Policy

    • The deposit was not refundable but you can postpone the booking to another time.
    • No refunds in case of bad weather conditions and customers’ reasons. Tour may be delayed by adverse weather conditions, but we take no responsibility in case of tour cancellation
    • If your bike has a technical brake down, we will replace it with the same type of bike and our guide/mechanic will attempt to fix your bike within a day. For technical reasons, your tour may be shortened, You will get a refund for the day you can’t finish
    • If you need to cancel your booking, you have the option to postpone to another time or transfer it to another person. Please note that you will be responsible for any associated administration costs, and it is your responsibility to ensure that your nominee pays the full amount

    Age Limitation and License Requirements:

    Although we do not have a specific age limit or license requirement, Vietnam Motorbike Tour Expert do require all participants to be in good health, physically fit, and capable of riding a motorbike
